AI does like 75% of the things I want it to do instantly and perfectly.

The other 25% are a disaster.

And I only really dare use it when I know the difference between the two.

But the 75% is so valuable and fast it makes up for the rest of it.

11 ways AI/ML projects die before they even launch:

1. The problem doesn't need AI

4. Data distribution changes, and no one notices
5. No feedback is built into the product
6. Inference
